subject: Psychology
title: Piaget's Stages of Development
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Piaget's Stages of Development.

hook.text: A four-year-old watches you pour water from a short glass into a tall one. 'Now there's more!' she insists. There isn't.

buildup.text: Jean Piaget proposed four cognitive stages: sensorimotor, preoperational, concrete operational, and formal operational.

discovery.text: Each stage represents a qualitative shift in how children think â€” not just knowing more, but thinking differently.

twist.text: Critics showed children are often more capable than Piaget believed. Simpler tasks reveal abilities his tests missed.

climax.text: Piaget's stages aren't perfectly accurate but remain the most influential framework in developmental psychology.

punchline.text: Children don't just know less. They think in a completely different way.

quiz.question: How many stages did Piaget propose in his theory of cognitive development?
